Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 57th overall pick, by Texas in 1971...
Injured on 5/10/1973 with a Bruised Ribs, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 6/17/1978, off Barry Lersch (DET)...
Injured on 6/23/1978 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 7/17/1978, off Bob O'Brien (OAK)...
Injured on 7/16/1979 with a Inflamed Thigh Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1984, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Catcher in 1985...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (A) on 2/10/1986 to a 2-year deal worth $1,754,000 per year...
